oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hank Snow Story by Mae Axton - 1955-02-15
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This recording is of Mae Axton telling the life story of Hank Snow. The recording is from February 15, 2019. Tape is the ninth of an unidentified number of tapes.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Snow; Mae Axton;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Mae Axton starting the Hank Snow Story with guitar in the background -- (00:12) Begins with Clarence Eugene Snow's birth in 1919 in Canada -- (00:36) First eight years of Snow's life, includes changing his name to Hank -- (2:10) At age 12, Snow sailed as a cabin boy - (3:00) Snow's love for music and guitars began -- (4:35) Snow learns the guitar -- (5:40) At 16, Snow completes his duty at sea, tries out different jobs, and starts to plan his future -- (9:33) Snow buys his first guitar -- (10:04) Snow's first public appearance -- (10:51) Snow's first time on the radio at the age of 19 -- (12:40) Snow met his wife, Minnie Blanch, at a Halloween party and married her a year later -- (14:48) Snow's first big, paid radio show and taught lessons on the side -- (16:34) Snow creates his first original songs -- (18:50) Snow starts to perform, and eventually live, in the United States of America -- (22:32) Snow moves back to Canada -- (25:58) Snow becomes a member of the Grand Ole Opry gang -- (27:39) Named America's Favorite Folk Singer and Number One Folk Singer -- (29:59) Snow's tour of Korea -- (30:42) Launching of the first National Hillbilly day -- (32:05) Snow's son, Jimmy Roger Snow -- (33:30) Permanent home in Nashville with his wife Min -- (34:47) Snow in present day 1955
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Snow, Hank; Axton, Mae Boren;
